tests.description: Using operator Number. This operator calls ToPrimitive with hint Number

tests.description: Using operator "+". This operator firstly calls ToPrimitive and then calls ToString or ToNumber

tests.commentary: Result of primitive conversion from object is a default value for the Object
tests.description: Using operator "<". The operator firstly calls ToPrimitive and then calls ToString or ToNumber

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from undefined value is false
tests.description: Undefined, void and others are converted to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from undefined value is false
tests.description: Undefined, void and others are converted to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from null value is false
tests.description: null convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from null value is false
tests.description: null convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from boolean value is no conversion
tests.description: true and false convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from boolean value is no conversion
tests.description: true and false convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from number value is false if the argument is +0, -0, or NaN; otherwise, is true
tests.description: +0, -0 and NaN convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from number value is false if the argument is +0, -0, or NaN; otherwise, is true
tests.description: +0, -0 and NaN convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from number value is false if the argument is +0, -0, or NaN; otherwise, is true
tests.description:
Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
Number.MAX_VALUE, Number.MIN_VALUE and some numbers convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from number value is false if the argument is +0, -0, or NaN; otherwise, is true
tests.description:
Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
Number.MAX_VALUE, Number.MIN_VALUE and some other numbers are converted to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from nonempty string value (length is not zero) is true; from empty String (length is zero) is false
tests.description: "" is converted to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from nonempty string value (length is not zero) is true; from empty String (length is zero) is false
tests.description: "" convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from nonempty string value (length is not zero) is true; from empty String (length is zero) is false
tests.description: Any nonempty string convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from nonempty string value (length is not zero) is true; from empty String (length is zero) is false
tests.description: Any nonempty string convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from object is true
tests.description: Different objects convert to Boolean by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of boolean conversion from object is true
tests.description: Different objects convert to Boolean by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of number conversion from undefined value is NaN
tests.description: Undefined convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.description: Undefined convert to Number by implicit transformation

tests.description: null convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of number conversion from null value is +0
tests.description: null convert to Number by implicit transformation

tests.description: False and true convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of number conversion from boolean value is 1 if the argument is true, else is +0
tests.description: False and true convert to Number by implicit transformation

tests.description: Some numbers including Number.MAX_VALUE and Number.MIN_VALUE are converted to Number with explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of number conversion from number value equals to the input argument (no conversion)
tests.description: Some numbers including Number.MAX_VALUE and Number.MIN_VALUE are converted to Number with implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of number conversion from number value equals to the input argument (no conversion)
tests.description:
Number.NaN, +0, -0, Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
Number.MAX_VALUE and Number.MIN_VALUE convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.description:
Number.NaN, +0, -0, Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
Number.MAX_VALUE and Number.MIN_VALUE convert to Number by implicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of number conversion from object value is the result
of conversion from primitive value
tests.description:
new Number(), new Number(0), new Number(Number.NaN), new Number(null),
new Number(void 0) and others convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of number conversion from object value is the result
of conversion from primitive value
tests.description:
new Number(), new Number(0), new Number(Number.NaN), new Number(null),
new Number(void 0) and others convert to Number by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: The MV of StringNumericLiteral ::: [empty] is 0
tests.description: Number('') convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral:::. DecimalDigits is the
MV of DecimalDigits times 10<sup><small>-n</small></sup>, where n is the
number of characters in DecimalDigits
tests.description: Compare Number('.12345') with +('12345')*1e-5

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral:::. DecimalDigits ExponentPart
is the MV of DecimalDigits times 10<sup><small>e-n</small></sup>, where n is
the number of characters in DecimalDigits and e is the MV of ExponentPart
tests.description:
Compare Number('.12345e6') with +('12345')*1e1,
and Number('.12345e-3') !== Number('12345')*1e-8

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: DecimalDigits ExponentPart
is the MV of DecimalDigits times 10<sup><small>e</small></sup>, where e is the MV of ExponentPart
tests.description:
Compare Number('12345e6') with +('12345')*1e1,
and Number('12345e-6') !== Number('12345')*1e-6

tests.commentary:
The MV of DecimalDigits ::: DecimalDigits DecimalDigit is
(the MV of DecimalDigits times 10) plus the MV of DecimalDigit
tests.description: Compare '12' with Number("1")*10+Number("2") and analogous

tests.commentary: The MV of SignedInteger ::: + DecimalDigits is the MV of DecimalDigits
The MV of SignedInteger ::: - DecimalDigits is the negative of the MV of DecimalDigits
The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 0 or of HexDigit ::: 0 is 0
tests.description: Compare Number('0x0') and Number('0X0') with 0

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 1 or of HexDigit ::: 1 is 1
tests.description: Compare Number('0x1') and Number('0X1') with 1

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 2 or of HexDigit ::: 2 is 2
tests.description: Compare Number('0x2') and Number('0X2') with 2

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 3 or of HexDigit ::: 3 is 3
tests.description: Compare Number('0x3') and Number('0X3') with 3

tests.commentary: The MV of StringNumericLiteral ::: StrWhiteSpace is 0
tests.description: Strings with various WhiteSpaces convert to Number by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 4 or of HexDigit ::: 4 is 4
tests.description: Compare Number('0x4') and Number('0X4') with 4

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 5 or of HexDigit ::: 5 is 5
tests.description: Compare Number('0x5') and Number('0X5') with 5

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 6 or of HexDigit ::: 6 is 6
tests.description: Compare Number('0x6') and Number('0X6') with 6

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 7 or of HexDigit ::: 7 is 7
tests.description: Compare Number('0x7') and Number('0X7') with 7

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 8 or of HexDigit ::: 8 is 8
tests.description: Compare Number('0x8') and Number('0X8') with 8

tests.commentary: The MV of DecimalDigit ::: 9 or of HexDigit ::: 9 is 9
tests.description: Compare Number('0x9') and Number('0X9') with 9

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: a or of HexDigit ::: A is 10
tests.description: Compare Number('0xA'), Number('0XA'), Number('0xa') and Number('0Xa') with 10

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: b or of HexDigit ::: B is 11
tests.description: Compare Number('0xB'), Number('0XB'), Number('0xb') and Number('0Xb') with 11

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: c or of HexDigit ::: C is 12
tests.description: Compare Number('0xC'), Number('0XC'), Number('0xc') and Number('0Xc') with 12

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: d or of HexDigit ::: D is 13
tests.description: Compare Number('0xD'), Number('0XD'), Number('0xd') and Number('0Xd') with 13

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: e or of HexDigit ::: E is 14
tests.description: Compare Number('0xE'), Number('0XE'), Number('0xe') and Number('0Xe') with 14

tests.commentary: The MV of HexDigit ::: f or of HexDigit ::: F is 15
tests.description: Compare Number('0xF'), Number('0XF'), Number('0xf') and Number('0Xf') with 15

tests.commentary:
Once the exact MV for a string numeric literal has been
determined, it is then rounded to a value of the Number type with 20
significant digits by replacing each significant digit after the 20th
with a 0 digit or the number value
tests.description: Use various long numbers, for example, 1234567890.1234567890

tests.commentary: The MV of StringNumericLiteral ::: StrWhiteSpaceopt StrNumericLiteral StrWhiteSpaceopt is the MV of StrNumericLiteral, no matter whether white space is present or not
tests.description: static string

tests.commentary: The MV of StringNumericLiteral ::: StrWhiteSpaceopt StrNumericLiteral StrWhiteSpaceopt is the MV of StrNumericLiteral, no matter whether white space is present or not
tests.description: dynamic string

tests.commentary: The MV of StrDecimalLiteral::: + StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral is the MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral
tests.description: Compare Number('+any_number') with Number('any_number')

tests.commentary: The MV of StrDecimalLiteral::: + StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral is the MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral
tests.description: Compare Number('+' + 'any_number') with Number('any_number')

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrDecimalLiteral::: - StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral is the negative
of the MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral. (the negative of this 0 is also 0)
tests.description: Compare Number('-any_number') with -Number('any_number')

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrDecimalLiteral::: - StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral is the negative
of the MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral. (the negative of this 0 is also 0)
tests.description: Compare Number('-[or +]any_number') with -[or without -]any_number)

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrDecimalLiteral::: - StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral is the negative
of the MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral. (the negative of this 0 is also 0)
tests.description: Compare Number('-' + 'any_number') with -Number('any_number')

tests.commentary: The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: Infinity is 1010000 (a value so large that it will round to +∞)
tests.description: Compare Number('Infinity') with Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, 10e10000, 10E10000 and Number("10e10000")

tests.commentary: The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: Infinity is 1010000 (a value so large that it will round to +∞)
tests.description: Compare Number('Infi'+'nity') with Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, 10e10000, 10E10000 and Number("10e10000")

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: DecimalDigits. DecimalDigits
is the MV of the first DecimalDigits plus the MV of the second DecimalDigits times
10<sup><small>-n</small></sup>, where n is the number of characters in the second DecimalDigits

The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: DecimalDigits. ExponentPart
is the MV of DecimalDigits times 10<sup><small>e</small></sup> , where e is the MV of ExponentPart
tests.description: Compare Number('1234e5') and Number('1234.e5') with Number('1234')*1e5

tests.commentary:
The MV of StrUnsignedDecimalLiteral::: DecimalDigits. DecimalDigits ExponentPart
is (the MV of the first DecimalDigits plus (the MV of the second DecimalDigits times
10<sup><small>-n</small></sup>)) times 10<sup><small>e</small></sup>, where n is the number
of characters in the second DecimalDigits and e is the MV of ExponentPart
If ToNumber(value) is NaN, ToInteger(value) returns +0
tests.description: Check what position is defined by Number.NaN in string "abc": "abc".charAt(Number.NaN)

tests.commentary:
If ToNumber(value) is +0, -0, +Infinity, or -Infinity,
return ToNumber(value)
tests.description: Check what position is defined by Number.NaN in string "abc": "abc".charAt(Number.NaN)

tests.commentary:
Result of ToInteger(value) conversion is the result of computing
sign(ToNumber(value)) * floor(abs(ToNumber(value)))
tests.description: For testing constructor Date(Number) is used

Result of ToInteger(value) conversion is the result of computing
sign(ToNumber(value)) * floor(abs(ToNumber(value)))

tests.commentary: Result of ToString conversion from undefined value is "undefined"
tests.description: Undefined values is undefined, void 0 and eval("var x"). Use explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of ToString conversion from undefined value is "undefined"
tests.description: Undefined values is undefined, void 0 and eval("var x"). Use implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of ToString conversion from null value is "null"
tests.description: null convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of ToString conversion from null value is "null"
tests.description: null convert to String by implicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of ToString conversion from boolean value is "true" if
the argument is "true", else is "false"
tests.description: True and false convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of ToString conversion from boolean value is "true" if
the argument is "true", else is "false"
tests.description: True and false convert to String by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of String conversion from string value is the input argument (no conversion)
tests.description: Some strings convert to String with explicit transformation

tests.commentary: Result of String conversion from string value is the input argument (no conversion)
tests.description: Some strings convert to String by implicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of String conversion from Object value is conversion
from primitive value
tests.description: Some objects convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Result of String conversion from Object value is conversion
from primitive value
tests.description: Some objects convert to String by implicit transformation

tests.commentary: If m is NaN, return the string "NaN"
tests.description: NaN convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Return the string consisting of the most significant
digit of the decimal representation of s, followed by a decimal point '.',
followed by the remaining k-1 digits of the decimal representation of s,
followed by the lowercase character 'e', followed by a plus sign '+' or
minus sign '-' according to whether n-1 is positive or negative, followed
by the decimal representation of the integer abs(n-1) (with no leading zeros)
tests.description: Various float numbers convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: If m is +0 or -0, return the string "0"
tests.description: +0 and -0 convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
If m is less than zero, return the string concatenation of the
string "-" and ToString(-m)
tests.description: -1234567890 convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: If m is infinity, return the string "Infinity"
tests.description: +/-Infinity convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
If 1 <= s < 1e21 or -1e21 s < -1, return the string
consisting of the k digits of the decimal representation of s (in order,
with no leading zeroes), followed by n-k occurrences of the character '0'
tests.description: Various integer numbers convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
If 1 <= s < 1e21 or -1e21 s < -1 and s has a fractional
component, return the string consisting of the most significant n digits of
the decimal representation of s, followed by a decimal point '.',
followed by the remaining k-n digits of the decimal representation of s
tests.description: 1.0000001 and -1.0000001 convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
If 1 > s > -1, and -6 < n <= 0, return the string consisting of the
character '0', followed by a decimal point '.', followed by -n occurrences
of the character '0', followed by the k digits of the decimal
representation of s
tests.description: Various float numbers convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Return the string consisting of the single digit of s,
followed by lowercase character 'e', followed by a plus sign '+' or minus
sign '-' according to whether n-1 is positive or negative, followed by the
decimal representation of the integer abs(n-1) (with no leading zeros)
tests.description: Various big numbers convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary:
Return the string consisting of the single digit of s,
followed by lowercase character 'e', followed by a plus sign '+' or minus
sign '-' according to whether n-1 is positive or negative, followed by the
decimal representation of the integer abs(n-1) (with no leading zeros)
tests.description: Various float numbers with many zeros convert to String by explicit transformation

tests.commentary: ToObject conversion from undefined value must throw TypeError
tests.description: Trying to convert undefined to Object

tests.commentary: ToObject conversion from null value must throw TypeError
tests.description: Trying to convert null to Object

tests.commentary:
ToObject conversion from Boolean: create a new Boolean object
whose [[value]] property is set to the value of the boolean
tests.description: Trying to convert from Boolean to Object

tests.commentary:
ToObject conversion from Number: create a new Number object
whose [[value]] property is set to the value of the number
tests.description: Converting from various numbers to Object

tests.commentary:
ToObject conversion from String: create a new String object
whose [[value]] property is set to the value of the string
tests.description: Converting from various strings to Object

tests.commentary:
ToObject conversion from Object: The result is the input
argument (no conversion)
tests.description: Converting from Objects to Object
